    • Method Detail

      • getLogMessages

        public LogMessages getLogMessages(java.lang.String id,
                         int startLine,
                         int usePool,
                         @Context
                         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)

        Returns the log messages from an ExecutePDTool execution beginning at a particular line. The returned object contains an array with the requested lines. The caller then uses the array size to adjust the starting line of the next call. The returned object also contains a boolean indicating that ExecutePDTool has completed its execution and polling for additional messages is no longer necessary.

        Parameters:
        id - The URL encoded path to look for.
        startLine - The line number of the log file to start from. Method returns all the lines from this line to the end of the file.
        usePool - Indicates whether to use the in-memory log pool.
        req - Servlet request object containing client request parameters.
        Returns:
        The requested LogMessages as an object. Serialized by Jackson into JSON.
